name: places/ChIJaUAjNfRZwokRa09OkuF8VOU
adrFormatAddress: 1650 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10128, USA

originalText.text: I've been going to Kevin for years. He's the best barber in the UES, especially if you're someone like me with longer than average hair for a guy. He takes his time, doesn't leave you waiting for booked appointments, and is worth the price. Highly recommended.

text.text: I've been going to Kevin for years. He's the best barber in the UES, especially if you're someone like me with longer than average hair for a guy. He takes his time, doesn't leave you waiting for booked appointments, and is worth the price. Highly recommended.

originalText.text: Kevin is great! He really put his all into my haircut and spend time making sure it was all perfect. Looks like I found my new go to place. I have paid more for haircuts that were half as good. Fantastic cut for the price.

text.text: Kevin is great! He really put his all into my haircut and spend time making sure it was all perfect. Looks like I found my new go to place. I have paid more for haircuts that were half as good. Fantastic cut for the price.

originalText.text:
Have been going to this place for close to a year, but today was the last day.
I had stuck with this place for two reasons:
- you book ahead of time and there is no waiting. Once you get there for your assigned time slot you are good to sit in the chair and you are typically done by the time the next person arrives
- only one barber with consistent average quality haircut. Nothing fancy, but you’ll never look bad
You don’t go here for the conversation, or to have a good relaxing time. There is none of that at Fademan, you go there for a reliable quick haircut. That’s it.
Seriously, his towels smell like they’ve not been washed in weeks. I have to shower as soon as I get home to get rid of the smell.
But that’s not the point. Now to the reason why today was my last haircut at Fademan and why I recommend people stay away from this overpriced, average quality barbershop with an owner/ barber that is generally rude to customers.
Let’s preface the story by quoting the 1st text I got from this man: “To all new clients:tips are cash only.”
Ok. No problem. Every single time after getting a cut I would go to the DR down the street and cash out $10 to give a tip after the cut was done. All good. Never had any complaints from the guy. I thought to my self I’m paying $76 (haircut + beard trim) + $10 tip, so close to $90 every time I go to this place. Expensive, but convenient, so whatever.
Today I bought gum after getting the $10 and instead of leaving my regular $10 I left $8 and get the text that comes next:
“Listen bro.you drop me 8bucks for haircut and beard ,you usually drop 10 . Honestly still short .8bucks for 70bucks service, you're so generous!My average tips are 10bucks for haircut,you are short tips all the time I never say anything right! Today 8 bucks ,thank you so much .You give the chance to block you permanently.have a great day.”
The guy literally blocked me for a tip that was $2 short of usual. It’s absurd. I’m already paying an overpriced haircut for you to go bananas over $2?!?!
I’ve seen him get pretty aggressive with walk ins. Guy is overall very rude, but today’s text was overboard.
In sum, OK expensive haircuts from a rude dude. I do not recommend. Get your haircuts from someone nicer. This place is not special anyway and does not support the price tag!

originalText.text: On top of being a very nice guy, Kevin is a great barber.  He's very professional and very attentive to details. His salon is always clean, it's also pretty big, it's in a convenient location and it always feels welcoming, I definitely recommend Kevin!!

text.text: On top of being a very nice guy, Kevin is a great barber.  He's very professional and very attentive to details. His salon is always clean, it's also pretty big, it's in a convenient location and it always feels welcoming, I definitely recommend Kevin!!

originalText.text: I’ve been going to Kevin for years - since 2016. When I heard he opened a new shop, I continued to be his client. He’s a remarkable barber. He’s young, has high attention to detail, experienced, and consistent. This dude won an award in competition for cutting hair. You won’t be disappointed.
